page.title: 01PRINCIPAL FEATURES OF WISTON
page.content: The village of Wiston lies close to the centre of the old Pembrokeshire, approx.2 miles north of the A.40 and approx. 5 miles N.E of Haverfordwest. It is a very small village centered around a Norman Castle and Church. The area is given over almost entirely to beef and dairy farming.The land is high in relation to the surronding countryside and there are magnificant views to the North and South. The primary school,St.Aidans V.A.is a new neighbourhood school and has children from Maenclochog in the North to Robesten Wathen in the East. The village being small in population and some distance from the main road,has no public transport services.Although this village is a pretty one and an attraction it has very poor amenities and does not have much trade except from the villagers.
